00047 typedef unsigned long spl_t;
00048 
00049 #define splhigh(x)  rthal_local_irq_save(x)
00050 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00051 #define splexit(x)  rthal_local_irq_restore((x) & 1)
00052 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00053 #define splexit(x)  rthal_local_irq_restore(x)
00054 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00055 #define splnone()   rthal_sti()
00056 #define spltest()   rthal_local_irq_test()
00057 #define splget(x)   rthal_local_irq_flags(x)
00058 #define splsync(x)  rthal_local_irq_sync(x)

00060 typedef unsigned long xnlock_t;
00061 
00062 #define XNARCH_LOCK_UNLOCKED 0
00063 
00064 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00065 
00066 #define xnlock_get_irqsave(lock,x)  ((x) = __xnlock_get_irqsave(lock))
00067 #define xnlock_clear_irqoff(lock)   xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,1)
00068 #define xnlock_clear_irqon(lock)    xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,0)
00069 
00070 static inline void xnlock_init (xnlock_t *lock) {
00071 
00072     *lock = XNARCH_LOCK_UNLOCKED;
00073 }
00074 
00075 static inline spl_t __xnlock_get_irqsave (xnlock_t *lock)
00076 
00077 {
00078     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00079     spl_t flags;
00080 
00081     rthal_local_irq_save(flags);
00082 
00083     adeos_load_cpuid();
00084 
00085     if (!test_and_set_bit(cpuid,lock))
00086         {
00087         while (test_and_set_bit(BITS_PER_LONG - 1,lock))
00088             /* Use a non-locking test in the inner loop, as Linux'es
00089                bit_spin_lock. */
00090             while (test_bit(BITS_PER_LONG - 1, lock))
00091                 cpu_relax();
00092         }
00093     else
00094         flags |= 2;
00095 
00096     return flags;
00097 }
00098 
00099 static inline void xnlock_put_irqrestore (xnlock_t *lock, spl_t flags)
00100 
00101 {
00102     if (!(flags & 2))
00103         {
00104         adeos_declare_cpuid;
00105 
00106         rthal_cli();
00107 
00108         adeos_load_cpuid();
00109 
00110         if (test_bit(cpuid,lock))
00111             {
00112             clear_bit(cpuid,lock);
00113             clear_bit(BITS_PER_LONG - 1,lock);
00114             cpu_relax(); /* FIXME: is this really needed ? */
00115             }
00116         }
00117 
00118     rthal_local_irq_restore(flags & 1);
00119 }
00120 
00121 #define XNARCH_PASSTHROUGH_IRQS /*empty*/
00122 
00123 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00124 
00125 #define xnlock_init(lock)              do { } while(0)
00126 #define xnlock_get_irqsave(lock,x)     rthal_local_irq_save(x)
00127 #define xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,x)  rthal_local_irq_restore(x)
00128 #define xnlock_clear_irqoff(lock)      rthal_cli()
00129 #define xnlock_clear_irqon(lock)       rthal_sti()
00130 
00131 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */

00184 typedef struct xnarchtcb {      /* Per-thread arch-dependent block */
00185 
00186     /* Kernel mode side */
00187 
00188 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00189     /* We only care for basic FPU handling in kernel-space; Altivec
00190        and SPE are not available to kernel-based nucleus threads. */
00191     rthal_fpenv_t fpuenv  __attribute__ ((aligned (16)));
00192     rthal_fpenv_t *fpup;        /* Pointer to the FPU backup area */
00193 #define xnarch_fpu_ptr(tcb)     ((tcb)->fpup)
00194 #else /* !CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00195 #define xnarch_fpu_ptr(tcb)     NULL
00196 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00197 
00198     unsigned stacksize;         /* Aligned size of stack (bytes) */
00199     unsigned long *stackbase;   /* Stack space */
00200     unsigned long ksp;          /* Saved KSP for kernel-based threads */
00201     unsigned long *kspp;        /* Pointer to saved KSP (&ksp or &user->thread.ksp) */
00202 
00203     /* User mode side */
00204     struct task_struct *user_task;      /* Shadowed user-space task */
00205     struct task_struct *active_task;    /* Active user-space task */
00206 
00207     /* Init block */
00208     struct xnthread *self;
00209     int imask;
00210     const char *name;
00211     void (*entry)(void *cookie);
00212     void *cookie;
00213 
00214 } xnarchtcb_t;

00242 static inline long long xnarch_tsc_to_ns (long long ts) {
00243     return xnarch_llimd(ts,1000000000,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ);
00244 }
00245 
00246 static inline long long xnarch_ns_to_tsc (long long ns) {
00247     return xnarch_llimd(ns,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ,1000000000);
00248 }
00249 
00250 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_time (void) {
00251     return xnarch_tsc_to_ns(xnarch_get_cpu_tsc());
00252 }

00254 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_freq (void) {
00255     return RTHAL_CPU_FREQ;
00256 }

00258 static inline unsigned xnarch_current_cpu (void) {
00259     return adeos_processor_id();
00260 }

00262 static inline void *xnarch_sysalloc (u_long bytes)
00263 
00264 {
00265 #if 0   /* FIXME: likely on-demand mapping bug here */
00266     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00267         return vmalloc(bytes);
00268 #endif
00269 
00270     return kmalloc(bytes,GFP_KERNEL);
00271 }
00272 
00273 static inline void xnarch_sysfree (void *chunk, u_long bytes)
00274 
00275 {
00276 #if 0   /* FIXME: likely on-demand mapping bug here */
00277     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00278         vfree(chunk);
00279     else
00280 #endif
00281         kfree(chunk);
00282 }

00299 static inline int xnarch_setimask (int imask)
00300 
00301 {
00302     spl_t s;
00303     splhigh(s);
00304     splexit(!!imask);
00305     return !!s;
00306 }

00310 static inline int xnarch_hook_irq (unsigned irq,
00311                                    void (*handler)(unsigned irq,
00312                                                    void *cookie),
00313                                    void *cookie)
00314 {
00315     int err = rthal_request_irq(irq,handler,cookie);
00316 
00317     if (!err)
00318         rthal_enable_irq(irq);
00319 
00320     return err;
00321 }
00322 
00323 static inline int xnarch_release_irq (unsigned irq) {
00324 
00325     return rthal_release_irq(irq);
00326 }
00327 
00328 static inline int xnarch_enable_irq (unsigned irq)
00329 
00330 {
00331     if (irq >= XNARCH_IRQ_MAX)
00332         return -EINVAL;
00333 
00334     rthal_enable_irq(irq);
00335 
00336     return 0;
00337 }
00338 
00339 static inline int xnarch_disable_irq (unsigned irq)
00340 
00341 {
00342     if (irq >= XNARCH_IRQ_MAX)
00343         return -EINVAL;
00344 
00345     rthal_disable_irq(irq);
00346 
00347     return 0;
00348 }

00355     rthal_enable_irq(irq);

00359 
00360     rthal_pend_linux_irq(ADEOS_TIMER_VIRQ);

00376 unsigned long xnarch_calibrate_timer (void)
00377 
00378 {
00379 #if  CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0
00380     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY);
00381 #else /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY unspecified. */
00382     /* Compute the time needed to program the decrementer in aperiodic
00383        mode. The return value is expressed in timebase ticks. */
00384     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(rthal_calibrate_timer());
00385 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0 */
00386 }
00387 
00388 static inline int xnarch_start_timer (unsigned long ns,
00389                                       void (*tickhandler)(void)) {
00390     return rthal_request_timer(tickhandler,ns);
00391 }
00392 
00393 static inline void xnarch_leave_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb)
00394 
00395 {
00396     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00397 
00398     adeos_load_cpuid();
00399 
00400     /* rthal_cpu_realtime is only tested for the current processor,
00401        and always inside a critical section. */
00402     __set_bit(cpuid,&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00403     /* Remember the preempted Linux task pointer. */
00404     rootcb->user_task = rootcb->active_task = rthal_get_current(cpuid);
00405     /* So that xnarch_save_fpu() will operate on the right FPU area. */
00406 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00407     rootcb->fpup = (rthal_fpenv_t *)&rootcb->user_task->thread.fpr[0];
00408 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00409 }
00410 
00411 static inline void xnarch_enter_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb) {
00412     __clear_bit(xnarch_current_cpu(),&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00413 }
00414 
00415 static inline void xnarch_switch_to (xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00416                                      xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb)
00417 {
00418     struct task_struct *outproc = out_tcb->active_task;
00419     struct task_struct *inproc = in_tcb->user_task;
00420     unsigned long flags;
00421 
00422     rthal_hw_lock(flags);
00423 
00424     in_tcb->active_task = inproc ?: outproc;
00425 
00426     if (inproc && inproc != outproc) /* User-space thread switch? */
00427         {
00428         struct mm_struct *prev = outproc->active_mm;
00429         struct mm_struct *next = inproc->active_mm;
00430 
00431         /* Switch the mm context.*/
00432 
00433         inproc->thread.pgdir = next->pgd;
00434 
00435         if (prev != next)
00436             {
00437             get_mmu_context(next);
00438             set_context(next->context, next->pgd);
00439             }
00440 
00441         if (!inproc->mm)
00442             enter_lazy_tlb(prev,inproc);
00443 
00444         /* The following has been lifted from
00445            arch/ppc/kernel/process.c. */
00446 
00447 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00448         if (outproc->thread.regs && (outproc->thread.regs->msr & MSR_FP))
00449             giveup_fpu(outproc);
00450 #ifdef CONFIG_ALTIVEC
00451         if ((outproc->thread.regs && (outproc->thread.regs->msr & MSR_VEC)))
00452             giveup_altivec(outproc);
00453 #endif /* CONFIG_ALTIVEC */
00454 #ifdef CONFIG_SPE
00455         if ((outproc->thread.regs && (outproc->thread.regs->msr & MSR_SPE)))
00456             giveup_spe(outproc);
00457 #endif /* CONFIG_SPE */
00458 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00459 
00460 #ifdef CONFIG_ALTIVEC
00461         if (inproc->thread.regs && last_task_used_altivec == inproc)
00462             inproc->thread.regs->msr |= MSR_VEC;
00463 #endif /* CONFIG_ALTIVEC */
00464 
00465 #ifdef CONFIG_SPE
00466         if (inproc->thread.regs && last_task_used_spe == inproc)
00467             inproc->thread.regs->msr |= MSR_SPE;
00468 #endif /* CONFIG_SPE */
00469 
00470         _switch(&outproc->thread,&inproc->thread);
00471         }
00472     else
00473         /* Kernel-to-kernel context switch. */
00474         rthal_switch_context(out_tcb->kspp,in_tcb->kspp);
00475 
00476     rthal_hw_unlock(flags);
00477 }
00478 
00479 static inline void xnarch_finalize_and_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb,
00480                                                xnarchtcb_t *next_tcb) {
00481     xnarch_switch_to(dead_tcb,next_tcb);
00482 }
00483 
00484 static inline void xnarch_finalize_no_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb) {
00485     /* Empty */
00486 }
00487 
00488 static inline void xnarch_init_root_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00489                                          struct xnthread *thread,
00490                                          const char *name)
00491 {
00492     tcb->user_task = current;
00493     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00494     tcb->ksp = 0;
00495     tcb->kspp = &tcb->ksp;
00496 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00497     tcb->fpup = NULL;
00498 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00499     tcb->entry = NULL;
00500     tcb->cookie = NULL;
00501     tcb->self = thread;
00502     tcb->imask = 0;
00503     tcb->name = name;
00504 }
00505 
00506 static inline void xnarch_init_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb) {
00507 
00508     tcb->user_task = NULL;
00509     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00510     tcb->kspp = &tcb->ksp;
00511 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00512     tcb->fpup = &tcb->fpuenv;
00513 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00514     /* Must be followed by xnarch_init_thread(). */
00515 }
00516 
00517 asmlinkage static void xnarch_thread_trampoline (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00518 
00519 {
00520     rthal_local_irq_restore(!!tcb->imask);
00521     xnpod_welcome_thread(tcb->self);
00522     tcb->entry(tcb->cookie);
00523     xnpod_delete_thread(tcb->self);
00524 }
00525 
00526 static inline void xnarch_init_thread (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00527                                        void (*entry)(void *),
00528                                        void *cookie,
00529                                        int imask,
00530                                        struct xnthread *thread,
00531                                        char *name)
00532 {
00533     unsigned long *ksp, flags;
00534 
00535     adeos_hw_local_irq_flags(flags);
00536 
00537     *tcb->stackbase = 0;
00538     ksp = (unsigned long *)((((unsigned long)tcb->stackbase + tcb->stacksize - 0x10) & ~0xf) - RTHAL_SWITCH_FRAME_SIZE);
00539     tcb->ksp = (unsigned long)ksp - STACK_FRAME_OVERHEAD;
00540     ksp[19] = (unsigned long)tcb; /* r3 */
00541     ksp[25] = (unsigned long)&xnarch_thread_trampoline; /* lr */
00542     ksp[26] = flags & ~MSR_EE; /* msr */
00543 
00544     tcb->entry = entry;
00545     tcb->cookie = cookie;
00546     tcb->self = thread;
00547     tcb->imask = imask;
00548     tcb->name = name;
00549 }
00550 
00551 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00552 
00553 {
00554 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00555     /* Initialize the FPU for an emerging kernel-based RT thread. This
00556        must be run on behalf of the emerging thread. */
00557     memset(&tcb->fpuenv,0,sizeof(tcb->fpuenv));
00558     rthal_init_fpu(&tcb->fpuenv);
00559 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00560 }
00561 
00562 static inline void xnarch_save_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00563 
00564 {
00565 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00566 
00567     struct task_struct *task = tcb->user_task;
00568 
00569     if (task)
00570         {
00571         if (task->thread.regs && (task->thread.regs->msr & MSR_FP))
00572             giveup_fpu(task);
00573 
00574         return;
00575         }
00576 
00577     /* Save the fp regs of the kernel thread owning the FPU. */
00578 
00579     rthal_save_fpu(tcb->fpup);
00580 
00581 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00582 }
00583 
00584 static inline void xnarch_restore_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00585 
00586 {
00587 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00588 
00589     if (tcb->user_task)
00590         /* On PowerpPC, we let the unavailability exception happen for
00591            the incoming user-space task if it happens to use the FPU,
00592            instead of eagerly reloading the fp regs upon switch. */
00593         return;
00594 
00595     /* Restore the fp regs of the incoming kernel thread. */
00596 
00597     rthal_restore_fpu(tcb->fpup);
00598 
00599 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00600 }
00601 
00602 int xnarch_sleep_on (int *flagp) {
00603 
00604     while (!*flagp)
00605         {
00606 #if !CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG
00607         set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00608         schedule_timeout(1);
00609 #else /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG. */
00610         set_current_state(TASK_INTERRUPTIBLE);
00611         schedule_timeout(1);
00612         if(signal_pending(current))
00613             return -ERESTARTSYS;
00614 #endif /* !CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG. */
00615         }
00616     return 0;
00617 }
00618 
00619 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00620 
00621 static inline int xnarch_send_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t cpumask) {
00622 
00623     return adeos_send_ipi(ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0, cpumask);
00624 }
00625 
00626 static inline int xnarch_hook_ipi (void (*handler)(void))
00627 
00628 {
00629     return adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00630                                      ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00631                                      (void (*)(unsigned)) handler,
00632                                      NULL,
00633                                      IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00634 }
00635 
00636 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void)
00637 
00638 {
00639     return adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00640                                      ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00641                                      NULL,
00642                                      NULL,
00643                                      IPIPE_PASS_MASK);
00644 }
00645 
00646 static inline void xnarch_notify_halt(void)
00647 
00648 {
00649     unsigned long flags = adeos_critical_enter(NULL);
00650     adeos_critical_exit(flags);
00651 }
00652 
00653 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00654 
00655 static inline int xnarch_send_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t cpumask) {
00656 
00657     return 0;
00658 }
00659 
00660 static inline int xnarch_hook_ipi (void (*handler)(void)) {
00661 
00662     return 0;
00663 }
00664 
00665 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void) {
00666 
00667     return 0;
00668 }
00669 
00670 #define xnarch_notify_halt() /* Nullified */
00671 
00672 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00673 
00674 static inline void xnarch_notify_shutdown(void)
00675 
00676 {
00677 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00678     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00679        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00680     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00681 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00682 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00683     xnshadow_release_events();
00684 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00685     /* Wait for the currently processed events to drain. */
00686     set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00687     schedule_timeout(50);
00688     xnarch_release_ipi();
00689 }
00690 
00691 static inline int xnarch_escalate (void)
00692 
00693 {
00694     extern int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00695 
00696     if (adp_current == adp_root)
00697         {
00698         spl_t s;
00699         splsync(s);
00700         adeos_trigger_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00701         splexit(s);
00702         return 1;
00703         }
00704 
00705     return 0;
00706 }
00707 
00708 static void xnarch_notify_ready (void)
00709 
00710 {
00711 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00712     xnshadow_grab_events();
00713 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00714 }
00715 
00716 #endif /* XENO_POD_MODULE */
00717 
00718 #ifdef XENO_SHADOW_MODULE
00719 
00720 static inline void xnarch_init_shadow_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00721                                            struct xnthread *thread,
00722                                            const char *name)
00723 {
00724     struct task_struct *task = current;
00725 
00726     tcb->user_task = task;
00727     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00728     tcb->ksp = 0;
00729     tcb->kspp = &task->thread.ksp;
00730 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00731     tcb->fpup = (rthal_fpenv_t *)&task->thread.fpr[0];
00732 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00733     tcb->entry = NULL;
00734     tcb->cookie = NULL;
00735     tcb->self = thread;
00736     tcb->imask = 0;
00737     tcb->name = name;
00738 }
00739 
00740 static inline void xnarch_grab_xirqs (void (*handler)(unsigned irq))
00741 
00742 {
00743     unsigned irq;
00744 
00745     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00746         adeos_virtualize_irq(irq,
00747                              handler,
00748                              NULL,
00749                              IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00750 
00751     /* On this arch, the decrementer trap is not an external IRQ but
00752        it is instead mapped to a virtual IRQ, so we must grab it
00753        individually. */
00754 
00755     adeos_virtualize_irq(ADEOS_TIMER_VIRQ,
00756                          handler,
00757                          NULL,
00758                          IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00759 }
00760 
00761 static inline void xnarch_lock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00762 
00763 {
00764     unsigned irq;
00765 
00766     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00767         {
00768         switch (irq)
00769             {
00770 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00771             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_IPI:
00772 
00773                 /* Never lock out this one. */
00774                 continue;
00775 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00776 
00777             default:
00778 
00779                 __adeos_lock_irq(adp,cpuid,irq);
00780             }
00781         }
00782 
00783     __adeos_lock_irq(adp,cpuid,ADEOS_TIMER_VIRQ);
00784 }
00785 
00786 static inline void xnarch_unlock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00787 
00788 {
00789     unsigned irq;
00790 
00791     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00792         {
00793         switch (irq)
00794             {
00795 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00796             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_IPI:
00797 
00798                 continue;
00799 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00800 
00801             default:
00802 
00803                 __adeos_unlock_irq(adp,irq);
00804             }
00805         }
00806 
00807     __adeos_unlock_irq(adp,ADEOS_TIMER_VIRQ);
00808 }
00809 
00810 #endif /* XENO_SHADOW_MODULE */
00811 
00812 #ifdef XENO_TIMER_MODULE
00813 
00814 static inline void xnarch_program_timer_shot (unsigned long delay) {
00815     /* Even though some architectures may use a 64 bits delay here, we
00816        voluntarily limit to 32 bits, 4 billions ticks should be enough for
00817        now. If a timer need more, a spurious but harmless call to the tick
00818        handler will occur after 4 billions ticks. Since the timebase value is
00819        used to express CPU ticks on the PowerPC port, there is no need to
00820        rescale the delay value. */
00821     rthal_set_timer_shot(delay);
00822 }
00823 
00824 static inline void xnarch_stop_timer (void) {
00825     rthal_release_timer();
00826 }
00827 
00828 static inline int xnarch_send_timer_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t mask)
00829 
00830 {
00831 #if CONFIG_SMP
00832     return -1;          /* FIXME */
00833 #else /* ! CONFIG_SMP */
00834     return 0;
00835 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00836 }
00837 
00838 static inline void xnarch_read_timings (unsigned long long *shot,
00839                                         unsigned long long *delivery,
00840                                         unsigned long long defval)
00841 {
00842 #ifdef CONFIG_ADEOS_PROFILING
00843     int cpuid = adeos_processor_id();
00844     *shot = __adeos_profile_data[cpuid].irqs[__adeos_tick_irq].t_handled;
00845     *delivery = __adeos_profile_data[cpuid].irqs[__adeos_tick_irq].t_synced;
00846 #else /* !CONFIG_ADEOS_PROFILING */
00847     *shot = defval;
00848     *delivery = defval;
00849 #endif /* CONFIG_ADEOS_PROFILING */
00850 }
00851 
00852 #endif /* XENO_TIMER_MODULE */

00859 
00860 {
00861     atomic_set(&hcb->numaps,0);

00864     hcb->shmbase = NULL;

00867 static inline int xnarch_remap_page_range(struct vm_area_struct *vma,
00868                                           unsigned long uvaddr,
00869                                           unsigned long paddr,
00870                                           unsigned long size,
00871                                           pgprot_t prot)
00872 {
00873     return remap_pfn_range(vma,uvaddr,paddr >> PAGE_SHIFT,size,prot);
00874 }

00877 
00878 #ifdef XENO_MAIN_MODULE
00879 
00880 #include <nucleus/asm/calibration.h>
00881 
00882 extern u_long nkschedlat;
00883 
00884 extern u_long nktimerlat;
00885 
00886 int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00887 
00888 int xnpod_trap_fault(xnarch_fltinfo_t *fltinfo);
00889 
00890 void xnpod_schedule_handler(void);
00891 
00892 static rthal_trap_handler_t xnarch_old_trap_handler;
00893 
00894 static int xnarch_trap_fault (adevinfo_t *evinfo)
00895 
00896 {
00897     xnarch_fltinfo_t fltinfo;
00898     fltinfo.regs = (struct pt_regs *)evinfo->evdata;
00899     return xnpod_trap_fault(&fltinfo);
00900 }
00901 
00902 static inline unsigned long xnarch_calibrate_timer (void)
00903 
00904 {
00905 #if CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0
00906     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY);
00907 #else /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY unspecified. */
00908     /* Compute the time needed to program the PIT in aperiodic
00909        mode. The return value is expressed in CPU ticks. Depending on
00910        whether CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC is enabled or not in the kernel
00911        configuration RTAI is compiled against,
00912        CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY will either refer to the local
00913        APIC or 8254 timer latency value. */
00914     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(rthal_calibrate_timer());
00915 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0 */
00916 }
00917 
00918 int xnarch_calibrate_sched (void)
00919 
00920 {
00921     nktimerlat = xnarch_calibrate_timer();
00922 
00923     if (!nktimerlat)
00924         return -ENODEV;
00925 
00926     nkschedlat = xnarch_ns_to_tsc(xnarch_get_sched_latency());
00927 
00928     return 0;
00929 }
00930 
00931 static inline int xnarch_init (void)
00932 
00933 {
00934     int err = 0;
00935 
00936 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00937     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00938        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00939     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00940 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00941 
00942     xnarch_escalation_virq = adeos_alloc_irq();
00943 
00944     if (xnarch_escalation_virq == 0)
00945         return -ENOSYS;
00946 
00947     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00948                               xnarch_escalation_virq,
00949                               (void (*)(unsigned))&xnpod_schedule_handler,
00950                               NULL,
00951                               IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00952 
00953     xnarch_old_trap_handler = rthal_set_trap_handler(&xnarch_trap_fault);
00954 
00955 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00956     err = xnshadow_mount();
00957 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00958 
00959     if (err)
00960         adeos_free_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00961     else
00962         err = xnarch_calibrate_sched();
00963 
00964     return err;
00965 }
00966 
00967 static inline void xnarch_exit (void)
00968 
00969 {
00970 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00971     xnshadow_cleanup();
00972 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00973     rthal_set_trap_handler(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
00974     adeos_free_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00975 }
00976 
00977 #endif /* XENO_MAIN_MODULE */
00978 
00979 #ifdef __cplusplus
00980 }
00981 #endif

00989 #define xnarch_post_graph_if(obj,state,cond)
